含义: The character '三' means 'three' in Chinese. It represents the number 3 and is used in various contexts to denote quantity, order, or repetition.
字形: The character '三' consists of three horizontal strokes of equal length, stacked vertically. It is one of the simplest Chinese characters in terms of structure.
读音: The pronunciation of '三' is 'sān' in Mandarin Chinese, with the first tone (high and level).
字源: The character '三' originated from ancient Chinese pictographs, where three horizontal lines were used to represent the number three. It is one of the earliest numerals in Chinese writing.
常用词组: 三伏 (sānfú) - dog days of summer
成语: 三心二意 (sān xīn èr yì) - indecisive
三顾茅庐 (sān gù máo lú) - repeatedly request someone's help
三生有幸 (sān shēng yǒu xìng) - extremely lucky
三言两语 (sān yán liǎng yǔ) - in a few words
三长两短 (sān cháng liǎng duǎn) - unexpected misfortune
例句: 他三思而后行。 (Tā sānsī ér hòu xíng.) - He thinks twice before acting.
三更半夜，他还在工作。 (Sāngēng bànyè, tā hái zài gōngzuò.) - He was still working at midnight.
短故事: In ancient China, the number three was considered a symbol of harmony and balance. The phrase '三生有幸' (sān shēng yǒu xìng) reflects the belief that meeting someone special is a rare fortune that spans three lifetimes.
The idiom '三顾茅庐' (sān gù máo lú) originates from the story of Liu Bei visiting Zhuge Liang three times to seek his assistance, symbolizing sincerity and persistence.
诗词: 《静夜思》 - 李白 (Jìng yè sī - Lǐ Bái): '床前明月光，疑是地上霜。举头望明月，低头思故乡。' (The moonlight before my bed, I suspect it's frost on the ground. I raise my head to gaze at the moon, then lower it, thinking of home.)

《登鹳雀楼》 - 王之涣 (Dēng Guànquè Lóu - Wáng Zhīhuàn): '白日依山尽，黄河入海流。欲穷千里目，更上一层楼。' (The sun sets behind the mountains, the Yellow River flows into the sea. To extend the view a thousand miles, ascend yet one more floor.)
